svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
June 24, 2023" date: "2023-06-24"
Eth News and Links
Dencun (Cancun + Deneb) upgrade
* Latest all core devs – execution (ACDE) call video . Summary by Tim Beiko . Notes
from Tim Beiko and Christine Kim : Overview of execution spec tests , Python suite of
state & blockchain tests Dencun upgrade discussions: EIP4844 precompile address moved
to 0xA, EIP4788 storage size bounded, EIP5656 (MCOPY) tests added and Engine API spec
changes EIP4844 devnet 6 had issues, restart as devnet 7 once stable client releases &
pass hive tests EIP repo to split out app layer ERCs
Latest all core devs – execution (ACDE) call video . Summary by Tim Beiko . Notes
from Tim Beiko and Christine Kim :
* Overview of execution spec tests , Python suite of state & blockchain tests
Overview of execution spec tests , Python suite of state & blockchain tests
* Dencun upgrade discussions: EIP4844 precompile address moved to 0xA, EIP4788 storage
size bounded, EIP5656 (MCOPY) tests added and Engine API spec changes
Dencun upgrade discussions: EIP4844 precompile address moved to 0xA, EIP4788 storage
* EIP4844 devnet 6 had issues, restart as devnet 7 once stable client releases & pass
hive tests
EIP4844 devnet 6 had issues, restart as devnet 7 once stable client releases & pass
* EIP repo to split out app layer ERCs
EIP repo to split out app layer ERCs
* Consensus specs v1.4.0-beta.0 : Deneb feature complete, stable unless issues found
Consensus specs v1.4.0-beta.0 : Deneb feature complete, stable unless issues found
* EIP4844: Kelvin: Mr. Moloch's ephemeral album party contribution to KZG ceremony
* Kelvin: Mr. Moloch's ephemeral album party contribution to KZG ceremony
Layer 1
* Reth v0.1.0-alpha : execution layer client in Rust, syncs archive node in 50 hours
with 2TB database using NVMe SSD, also SDK for building EVM infrastructure, Apache/MIT
license
Reth v0.1.0-alpha : execution layer client in Rust, syncs archive node in 50 hours
* EthereumJS v6 (final release before v7): updates ethereum-cryptography, adds
allowUnlimitedInitcodeSize option and removes non-finalized state code (EIP4844)
EthereumJS v6 (final release before v7): updates ethereum-cryptography, adds
* Verkle tries info website
Verkle tries info website
Client releases
* Consensus layer: Lodestar v1.9.0 : fix reduced slashing DB size by 97%, slashing
protection export format compatible with other clients and flag to disable peer
scoring for testing Nimbus v23.6.0 : history prune enabled by default, processes
untimely attestations without expensive state replays and use Keymanager API for
voluntary exits
Consensus layer:
* Lodestar v1.9.0 : fix reduced slashing DB size by 97%, slashing protection export
format compatible with other clients and flag to disable peer scoring for testing
Lodestar v1.9.0 : fix reduced slashing DB size by 97%, slashing protection export
* Nimbus v23.6.0 : history prune enabled by default, processes untimely attestations
without expensive state replays and use Keymanager API for voluntary exits
Nimbus v23.6.0 : history prune enabled by default, processes untimely attestations
* Execution layer: Erigon v2.47.0 : fix for v2.45.0, no resync required
Execution layer:
* Erigon v2.47.0 : fix for v2.45.0, no resync required
For Stakers
* Execution Layer client diversity improved , Geth around 50%
Research
* Fast amortized KZG proofs
Fast amortized KZG proofs
* Speculative execution DoS attacks using conditional transactions to exhaust
resources and/or transaction pool spamming
Speculative execution DoS attacks using conditional transactions to exhaust resources
and/or transaction pool spamming
Layer 2
* Zora Network for NFTs, optimistic rollup built on OP stack, live
Zora Network for NFTs, optimistic rollup built on OP stack, live
* Arbitrum Orbit chains (layer 3): guide to launch a devnet
Arbitrum Orbit chains (layer 3): guide to launch a devnet
* L2Beat Stages : rollup maturity framework from stage 0 (run by the operators) to
stage 2 (fully managed by contracts)
L2Beat Stages : rollup maturity framework from stage 0 (run by the operators) to stage
2 (fully managed by contracts)
* Shared validity sequencing proposal to enable cross-rollup interoperability
Shared validity sequencing proposal to enable cross-rollup interoperability
* Vitalik: L2 to L1 & cross-L2 reading to implement cross-chain social recovery
wallets with a keystore in one location & wallets in many locations
Vitalik: L2 to L1 & cross-L2 reading to implement cross-chain social recovery wallets
with a keystore in one location & wallets in many locations
EIPs/Standards
* EIPs: Meta EIP7199 : Linter scope EIP7212 : Precompile for secp256r1 curve support
EIPs:
* Meta EIP7199 : Linter scope
Meta EIP7199 : Linter scope
* EIP7212 : Precompile for secp256r1 curve support
EIP7212 : Precompile for secp256r1 curve support
* ERCs (app layer): ERC838 : ABI specification for REVERT reason string ERC7196 :
Simple token ERC7201 : Namespaced storage layout ERC7202 : Offchain checks (for low
cost ERC1155 distribution) ERC7204 : Contract wallet management asset ERC7208 :
MetaNFT keystore contracts
ERCs (app layer):
* ERC838 : ABI specification for REVERT reason string
ERC838 : ABI specification for REVERT reason string
* ERC7196 : Simple token
ERC7196 : Simple token
* ERC7201 : Namespaced storage layout
ERC7201 : Namespaced storage layout
* ERC7202 : Offchain checks (for low cost ERC1155 distribution)
ERC7202 : Offchain checks (for low cost ERC1155 distribution)
* ERC7204 : Contract wallet management asset
ERC7204 : Contract wallet management asset
* ERC7208 : MetaNFT keystore contracts
ERC7208 : MetaNFT keystore contracts
Stuff for developers
* Hardhat: v2.16.0 : adds extendable providers, wrap network provider with custom
logic Hardhat-ledger plugin : send transactions & sign messages
Hardhat:
* v2.16.0 : adds extendable providers, wrap network provider with custom logic
v2.16.0 : adds extendable providers, wrap network provider with custom logic
* Hardhat-ledger plugin : send transactions & sign messages
Hardhat-ledger plugin : send transactions & sign messages
* Alloy : rewrite of ethers-rs, includes Solidity's type system in Rust
Alloy : rewrite of ethers-rs, includes Solidity's type system in Rust
* Guide to Solidity data locations (memory, calldata & storage)
Guide to Solidity data locations (memory, calldata & storage)
* Cookbook ChefGPT Remix plugin to answer Solidity questions including on current
contract
Cookbook ChefGPT Remix plugin to answer Solidity questions including on current
* Intro to Ape (contract development framework for Python devs) using WETH as an
example
Intro to Ape (contract development framework for Python devs) using WETH as an example
* Uniswap v4 flash loan template
Uniswap v4 flash loan template
* Seaport Validator & Navigator : helper contracts to scan orders for errors and
fulfill respectively
Seaport Validator & Navigator : helper contracts to scan orders for errors and fulfill
respectively
* Simon de la Rouviere: Daisychains NFT onchain SVG animation [Andrew had one free
mint]
Simon de la Rouviere: Daisychains NFT onchain SVG animation [Andrew had one free mint]
* Smoldata : zero-ETL indexing for contracts
Smoldata : zero-ETL indexing for contracts
Security
* Astaria (NFT lending) vulnerability disclosed , protocol paused with tokens rescued,
beacon proxy could be manipulated to load rogue implementation allowing self destruct
Astaria (NFT lending) vulnerability disclosed , protocol paused with tokens rescued,
* Foundation NFT contracts vulnerability disclosed , contract owner can self destruct
implementation, destroying minted NFTs
Foundation NFT contracts vulnerability disclosed , contract owner can self destruct
* Tincho: questions auditors should ask devs before a secure code review.
Tincho: questions auditors should ask devs before a secure code review.
Ecosystem
* Etherscan code reader , answers questions about a specific contract address, OpenAI
API key required, beta
Enterprise
* Paul Brody: Ethereum for Business book
Paul Brody: Ethereum for Business book
* SAP demoing cross border payments with USDC : customers can pay a sample invoice on
testnet
SAP demoing cross border payments with USDC : customers can pay a sample invoice on
Notable at app layer
* Maker sDAI (savings DAI): tokenized DSR-enabled DAI, ERC4626
Maker sDAI (savings DAI): tokenized DSR-enabled DAI, ERC4626
* Utopia transaction templates for Safe multisig on mainnet
Utopia transaction templates for Safe multisig on mainnet
* PartyDAO Party : create groups with lightweight voting to take onchain actions
PartyDAO Party : create groups with lightweight voting to take onchain actions
* Mirror collectable embeds : mint or buy on secondary NFTs embedded in posts
Mirror collectable embeds : mint or buy on secondary NFTs embedded in posts
* Noun Nyms : persistent pseudonyms for Noun holders with reddit-like interface
Noun Nyms : persistent pseudonyms for Noun holders with reddit-like interface
* Ethscriptions : create/transfer digital artifacts using data URI in calldata,
similar to Bitcoin Ordinals
Ethscriptions : create/transfer digital artifacts using data URI in calldata, similar
to Bitcoin Ordinals
* BND (German foreign intelligence) released dog NFTs
BND (German foreign intelligence) released dog NFTs
* Sudo v2 gradual dutch auction bonding curves
Sudo v2 gradual dutch auction bonding curves
* Gitcoin grants stack : create & manage a grants program
Gitcoin grants stack : create & manage a grants program
Job Listings
* Devconnect Istanbul: Production Assistant and Volunteer Coordinator
Devconnect Istanbul: Production Assistant and Volunteer Coordinator
* Solidity team need a highly skilled Developer Advocate
Solidity team need a highly skilled Developer Advocate
Job listings: $600 for four issues (75 character limit), payable to abcoathup.eth.
Questions? abcoathup at-gmail
Regulation/business/tokens
* FT: Crypto.com internal trading teams potential conflict of interest
General/crypto
* Polygon PoS proposal to upgrade to a zkEVM validium in 2024
Polygon PoS proposal to upgrade to a zkEVM validium in 2024
* BSC adding layer 2 (Optimism fork) on testnet
BSC adding layer 2 (Optimism fork) on testnet
* Security proof of Nova on a cycle of curves
Security proof of Nova on a cycle of curves
Follow @WeekinEthNews to find out what the most clicked links are. Follow @abcoathup
and @evan_van_ness to get most of the week’s news in real time.
Permalink for this week’s issue:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-june-24-2023
Upcoming Dates of Note
(new/changes in bold )
* Jun 26 – Jul 17 – CLRFund round 9
Jun 26 – Jul 17 – CLRFund round 9
* Jul 5-9 – ETHBarcelona conference & hackathon
Jul 5-9 – ETHBarcelona conference & hackathon
* Jul 17-20 – EthCC (Paris)
Jul 17-20 – EthCC (Paris)
* Jul 20–23 – Pragma Paris & ETHGlobal Paris hackathon
Jul 20–23 – Pragma Paris & ETHGlobal Paris hackathon
* Aug 11-13 – ETHMunich hackathon
Aug 11-13 – ETHMunich hackathon
* Aug 15-16 – ETHToronto & ETHWomen
Aug 15-16 – ETHToronto & ETHWomen
* Aug 16-19 – Ethereum Argentina (Buenos Aires)
Aug 16-19 – Ethereum Argentina (Buenos Aires)
* Aug 28-30 – Science of Blockchain Conference (Stanford University)
Aug 28-30 – Science of Blockchain Conference (Stanford University)
* Aug 30 – Sep 3 – ETHWarsaw conference & hackathon
Aug 30 – Sep 3 – ETHWarsaw conference & hackathon
* Sep 1-3 – Ethcon Korea hackathon
Sep 1-3 – Ethcon Korea hackathon
* Sep 10-12 – Ethereum Singapore hackathon & conference
Sep 10-12 – Ethereum Singapore hackathon & conference
* Sep 11-13 – DappCon (Berlin)
Sep 11-13 – DappCon (Berlin)
* Sep 15 – Protocol Berg (Berlin)
Sep 15 – Protocol Berg (Berlin)
* Sep 15-17 – ETHChicago conference & hackathon
Sep 15-17 – ETHChicago conference & hackathon
* Sep 18-21 – ETH Montréal conference & hackathon
Sep 18-21 – ETH Montréal conference & hackathon
* Sep 22–24 – ETHGlobal New York
Sep 22–24 – ETHGlobal New York
* Oct 5-6 – ETHMilan conference
Oct 5-6 – ETHMilan conference
* Oct 6-8 – ETHRome hackathon
Oct 6-8 – ETHRome hackathon
* Oct 6–27 – ETHOnline (ETHGlobal) virtual
Oct 6–27 – ETHOnline (ETHGlobal) virtual
* Oct 13–15 – Ethereum Kuala Lumpur conference & hackathon
Oct 13–15 – Ethereum Kuala Lumpur conference & hackathon
* Oct 27–29 – ETH Miami festival & hackathon
Oct 27–29 – ETH Miami festival & hackathon
* Nov 3-5 – ETH Lisbon hackathon
Nov 3-5 – ETH Lisbon hackathon
* Nov 3-5 – ETHBrno
Nov 3-5 – ETHBrno
* Nov 13-19 – Devconnect (Istanbul)
Nov 13-19 – Devconnect (Istanbul)
* Nov 17-19 – ETHGlobal Istanbul
Nov 17-19 – ETHGlobal Istanbul

Week in Ethereum News
